alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 8:11AM EDT until June 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of the Lower Keys in Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Niles Channel Bridge, Summerland Key, Ramrod Key, Middle Torch Key, Big Torch Key, Little Torch Key, Cudjoe Key and Big Pine Key. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. If you observe flooding, contact your Key West National Weather Service office at 3 0 5...295...1 3 1 6...extension 3.
